Class Staff

java.lang.Object
hms.User
hms.Staff
Direct Known Subclasses:
Doctor, Pharmacist
public abstract class Staff extends User
The Staff class is an abstract class that extends User and represents staff members in the hospital management system. It includes additional attributes specific to staff, such as gender, age, phone number, email address, and specialization.

  • Constructor Details

    • Staff

      public Staff(Scanner scanner, String role) throws IOException
      Constructs a new Staff object by prompting the user for input via a Scanner. This constructor is typically used when creating a new staff member.
      Parameters:
      scanner - The Scanner object to read user input.
      role - The role of the staff member (e.g., "doctor", "pharmacist").
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs during saving.

    • Staff

      public Staff(String id, String name, String password, String role) throws IOException
      Constructs a new Staff object by loading staff data from a file. This constructor is typically used when loading an existing staff member.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the staff member.
      name - The name of the staff member.
      password - The password of the staff member.
      role - The role of the staff member.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs during loading staff data.

    • updatePhoneNumber

      public void updatePhoneNumber(String phoneNumber) throws Exception
      Updates the phone number of the staff member after validating it.
      Parameters:
      phoneNumber - The new phone number to set (must be an 8-digit number).
      Throws:
      Exception - If the phone number is invalid.

      Throws:

    • setName

      public void setName(String name)

    • save

      public void save() throws IOException
      Saves the staff member's data to the staff CSV file. If the staff member already exists, their data is updated; otherwise, a new entry is added.
      Overrides:
      save in class User
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs during saving.
